column4: so: sudo apt-get nvidia-installer uninstall , then add, then install driver again
seems like no problem... i'm using it, all is ok
did you add DISABLED_MODULES="nv nvidia_new" to your /etc/default/linux-restricted-modules-common before installing?
no... i didnt know about something like this
does it matter which version i'll install? (if official from nvidia site, or propietary driver?)
i'm not sure, i installed from official. 173 and 177 beta work well with that fix for me, but don't work without it
, so after adding nv nvidia_new to restricted modules, it works even worst... both driver wont load X corretly.. now I run 800x600 :-/
what videocard do you have? and did you automatically configured xorg.conf in nvidia-driver installation?
I am, where I was at beginning
well.... glxinfo shows everything good, but compiz complains :-/
somehow.. somewhere... compiz works with 173 driver :D
so, now everything is fine?
yes :) btw, this driver is only manually updateable right?
don't know... i've manually installed new version (177 beta)
it was my first thx, cause i'm using Linux only for 4-th day))) good luck
I for 2 years :D
heh :) now i'm trying to use envyng-gtk for auto-installing NVidia drivers, cause my manual installation gave me bug: Ctrl+Alt+F[1-6] causes to Blank Screen instead of tty
that's not so hard :D
i searched for solution and found that many people has the same issue, but their solutions don't work for me
GL you too)
